headline: Coinbase, ExxonMobil & Chevron, Moderna: Trending Tickers
summary: Coinbase (COIN) shares are under pressure after a drop in adjusted profit, with sluggish retail crypto trading volumes despite rising crypto prices. ExxonMobil (XOM) and Chevron (CVX) reported steep profit declines in the second quarter, though both topped revenue expectations as oil production hit record levels. Moderna (MRNA) reported a smaller loss than expected in Q2 but lowered the high-end of its full-year revenue outlook amid shipment delays to the UK. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

ExxonMobil (XOM) and Chevron (CVX) reported steep profit declines in the second quarter, though both topped revenue expectations as oil production hit record levels.

Moderna (MRNA) reported a smaller loss than expected in Q2 but lowered the high-end of its full-year revenue outlook amid shipment delays to the UK.

headline: Moderna's Key Patent Win Overshadowed By Gloomy Outlook
summary: Moderna Inc. (NASDAQ:MRNA) reported on Friday a second-quarter loss of $2.13 per share, beating the consensus of a $2.98 loss, an improvement from a loss of $3.33 a year ago. The COVID-19 vaccine maker reported quarterly sales of $142 million, beating the consensus of $116.34 million. Sales fell 41% from $241 million in the same period in 2024. The decline was primarily driven by lower COVID-19 vaccine sales, which totaled $114 million in the quarter. Also Read: Robert Kennedy Jr Blasts Vaccine

headline: Moderna lowers top end of revenue guidance as vaccine group targets cost cuts
summary: Investing.com - Moderna has lowered the top end of its full-year revenue forecast, citing a delay in the timing of deliveries of its COVID-19 jab to the United Kingdom, presenting a fresh setback for a company already aiming to slash expenses and boost recently tepid demand.

headline: Moderna (NASDAQ:MRNA) Exceeds Q2 Expectations But Stock Drops
summary: Biotechnology company Moderna (NASDAQ:MRNA) reported Q2 CY2025 results exceeding the market’s revenue expectations, but sales fell by 41.1% year on year to $142 million. On the other hand, the company’s full-year revenue guidance of $1.85 billion at the midpoint came in 10.6% below analysts’ estimates. Its GAAP loss of $2.13 per share was 29.8% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

content.title: Moderna (NASDAQ:MRNA) Exceeds Q2 Expectations But Stock Drops
content.summary: Biotechnology company Moderna (NASDAQ:MRNA) reported Q2 CY2025 results exceeding the market’s revenue expectations, but sales fell by 41.1% year on year to $142 million. On the other hand, the company’s full-year revenue guidance of $1.85 billion at the midpoint came in 10.6% below analysts’ estimates. Its GAAP loss of $2.13 per share was 29.8% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Moderna cuts sales forecast on UK revenue delay, shares fall
summary: (Reuters) -Moderna trimmed its 2025 revenue forecast on Friday after UK deliveries of some COVID vaccines were deferred to next year, overshadowing lower-than-expected second-quarter loss and sending its shares down 7%.  The revised forecast of between $1.5 billion and $2.2 billion reflects ongoing headwinds for the vaccine maker, which is grappling with slumping demand for COVID-19 shots, a slower-than-expected RSV rollout and regulatory delays in its new product pipeline.  Moderna said 40% to 50% of this year's revenue would be recognized in the third quarter, with the remainder expected in the fourth.

content.title: Moderna cuts sales forecast on UK revenue delay, shares fall
content.summary: (Reuters) -Moderna trimmed its 2025 revenue forecast on Friday after UK deliveries of some COVID vaccines were deferred to next year, overshadowing lower-than-expected second-quarter loss and sending its shares down 7%.  The revised forecast of between $1.5 billion and $2.2 billion reflects ongoing headwinds for the vaccine maker, which is grappling with slumping demand for COVID-19 shots, a slower-than-expected RSV rollout and regulatory delays in its new product pipeline.  Moderna said 40% to 50% of this year's revenue would be recognized in the third quarter, with the remainder expected in the fourth.

summary: CAMBRIDGE, MA / ACCESS Newswire / August 1, 2025 / Moderna, Inc. (NASDAQ:MRNA) today announced that the UK Court of Appeal has upheld the validity of Moderna's EP'949 patent. This decision affirms the High Court's initial ruling from July 2024 that ...
